Title: Software Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to work as a Software Developer in a team that is focusing on delivering the best possible user experience? Would you like to be part of a company that supports more than 200,000 Danish companies, helping them achieve excellence in their daily operations?




With thousands of users relying on our solutions for critical tasks like bookkeeping, invoicing, and tax reporting, we're on a mission to sustain and enhance our leading edge.




If this sounds exciting to you, keep on reading.




The Scope of Your Role

We are looking for a Software Developer (C#/React) to join a dynamic team dedicated to redefining the financial technology landscape. Our ideal candidate is a tech enthusiast that is used to working with .NET technologies and React.




Your team

You‚Äôll be part of a collaborative team with four members in Denmark, and one in Norway. We are a team that enjoys challenges and likes to have fun while concurring them.

So get ready to dive into an environment where teamwork and collaboration are key.

You will have plenty of opportunities for professional growth, working alongside specialists to enhance your technical skills and knowledge. We are working with both frontend, backend, and everything in between.




Briefly about the broader Products department (R&D)

You will be joining our development organisation Products (R&D) with +160 employees, primarily located in Denmark, Romania and Portugal, working with technologies like C#, Node.js, React, MS-SQL, Swift and MongoDB. We are a diverse group of +20 nationalities, including Developers, Product Owners, QA Engineers and UX Designers.




Your main tasks

The development of scalable and robust software solutions in a .NET ecosystem with a focus on C#
Deliver quality code, with high performance and reliability, through comprehensive testing and review processes
Create and maintain documentation for software design, code, and system configurations
Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality, consistency, and adherence to best practices.
Be a part of cross-functional work to transform requirements into compelling features and services
Actively participate in team meetings, share knowledge, and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives
Assist in troubleshooting, debugging, and resolving software issues in areas where the team are the owners.




Skillset we imagine you have

We are looking for a software developer that likes to work on new projects, but also wants to use their creative abilities to enhance existing products. We expect you to have prior experience with SaaS platform development. You take pride in delivering software that helps our users become more efficient and grow their business. You are eager to learn and grow and possess a positive and proactive mindset.




Further, you can say yes to the following:

2-4 or more years of experience with software development
Proficient in English
Enjoys collaborating in small groups
Preferably based in Denmark
Knowledge of and experience with, Programming .NET Framework/.NET Core, C#, SQL, React, and familiar with Git, HTML, CSS
Naturally, take on the responsibility to help build a plan and ensure timely delivery




Your benefits

üë©‚Äçüíª Select your preferred gear, be it Mac or Windows.

üîç Engage with complex challenges and enjoy full autonomy in your projects.

üöÄ Two hack days each month to explore and execute your innovative ideas.

üèÖ A creative hackathon competition with prizes, held every year.

ü¶ã Adapt your work environment and hours to suit your lifestyle, with hybrid options available.

üåç An international and creative workplace with +38 nationalities.

üè• Comprehensive health insurance and company-paid pension.

üíÜüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Access a range of services to support your physical and mental health.

üìö We support your career aspirations with ample opportunities for growth.

üéâ Connect with colleagues at our regular team gatherings.




Your e-conomic Journey

If this role speaks to your career aspirations and personal values, we‚Äôd love to get to know you better.

Please send us your CV and respond to our job-specific questions. There‚Äôs no need for a cover letter, photo, age, or other personal details. We‚Äôre dedicated to creating a fair and unbiased recruitment process for you.




We‚Äôre truly excited to meet amazing candidates like you, so interviews will be held continuously.

If you have any further questions regarding the role or other relevant matters, please feel free to contact Hiring Manager, Christopher Heideby, at christopher.heideby@visma.com.




The recruitment process

First, hit that apply button and let's kickstart your e-conomic journey!




1. Initial screening

Have a chat with Hanne, our Talent Acquisition Partner, for about 30 min.




2. First interview

Meet Chris, our Manager for the BBT (Big Bank Theory) team. This interview will be around 60 min.




3. Second interview

Dive deeper into the technical aspects of the role with Chris and Kaveh, for around 90 min. There will also be a personality test feedback after the interview, together with Hanne and Chris, which will be around 30 min.




Prior to the interview you'll complete a personality test, and prepare for a case discussion.




.. following that, we look forward to welcoming you on board!




About e-conomic

We build and design a cloud-based accounting product that helps companies run their businesses. More than +200.000 happy customers use our product on a regular basis. We have more than 450 employees from +38 nationalities.




We are located in Carlsberg Byen together with all Visma's companies in the Metropolitan area. The 20,000 m¬≤ building is the largest commercial building in Carlsberg Byen with room for over 1100 employees, and is within walking distance of S-trains and the metro. Our building includes roof terraces, cafes, restaurant, fitness, courtyards and an atrium. Our home in Carlsberg Byen will be a place for knowledge and innovation, which contributes to Visma remaining one of the most attractive workplaces in Denmark.




At e-conomic we respect and value differences and find that a diverse workforce enables creativity and drives innovation. e-conomic is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits Discrimination, Harassment and Bullying of Any Kind.




All employment decisions at e-conomic are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to gender, race, age, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in Denmark. e-conomic therefore, encourages all interested to apply.

Title: Research Engineer, Applied AI
Description:
As a research engineer you will work on improving kapa‚Äôs ability to answer harder and harder technical questions.

In This Role, You Will


Work directly with the founding team and our software engineers.
Work on and do research in state-of-the-art retrieval and search techniques.
Work on and deploy machine learning models as part of RAG.
Continuously improve our quality evaluation frameworks to enable robust iteration.
Keep up with the latest developments in the space and see how they can be applied.
Design and run experiments.


In addition to the founding team, you'll have support from a number of leading academics in the field that are all close advisors (incl. Douwe Kiela, author of the original RAG paper).

You May Be a Good Fit If You Have


A Master's/ PhD degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field.
A detailed understanding of machine learning, deep learning (including LLMs) and natural language processing.
Hands-on experience in training, fine-tuning and deploying large language models.
Have prior experience working with vector databases, search indices, or other data stores for search and retrieval use cases.
Significant experience building evaluation systems for LLMs or search.
Familiarity with various information retrieval techniques, such as lexical search and dense vector search.
The ability to work effectively in a fast in a environment where things are sometimes loosely defined.
Want to learn more about machine learning research.
This is neither an exhaustive nor necessary set of attributes. Even if none of these apply to you, but you believe you will contribute to kapa.ai, please reach out.

Title: Solutions Engineer - Denmark
Description:
Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the fastest-growing startup ever, Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven track record of success and a culture that values world-class talent.

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 40% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We‚Äôre the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it‚Äôs still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you‚Äôll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

Summary

As an Solutions Engineer, you will be responsible for supporting our enterprise customers, reporting to the regional Solutions Engineering Manager. You will partner directly with regional account executives to help change our customers view and how they approach cloud security. You will be their trusted advisor for all matters related to cloud security across AWS, Azure, and GCP. We are passionate about technical sales and helping our customers achieve the maximum value from our solution.

What You‚Äôll Do


Partner with the sales team to provide technical leadership to our customers and prospective customers in conjunction with helping our team meet their quarterly sales targets.
Provide presentations to our customers and prospective customers such as whiteboards, product demonstrations, slides, and proof of value outcomes.
Help our customers and prospective customers plan in-depth test plans for showing the value of the Wiz platform in their environment (proof of value).
Invest time in learning new product features, industry related developments, and broadening your overall technical skillset.
Represent Wiz in technical forums such as trade shows, technical meet-ups, and industry events.


What You‚Äôll Bring


Ability to deliver world class demonstrations and training experience to our channel customers
Mastered the technical sales process
Thrive in a creative technical role assisting partners to build a technical business delivery model
Experience in a sales engineering role delivering solutions to C-level executives at enterprise customers
Ability to travel up to 50%
Cloud security experience
AWS/Azure/GCP hands on experience
Network engineering experience
Strong operating system, virtual machine, and container knowledge
Knowledge of risk-based security assessments and frameworks
Understanding of cloud identity, access, certificates, and keys


BONUS POINTS:


Experience with traditional CSPM tools
SaaS experience
Awareness of the CI/CD process
Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code


If your experience is close but doesn‚Äôt fulfill all requirements, please apply. Wiz is on a mission to build a special company. To achieve our goal, we are focused on hiring Wizards with different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences.

Wiz is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that Wiz will process your personal data in accordance with Wiz's Privacy Policy.

Title: Platform Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
In Dreamdata we are fixing the broken world of B2B sales and marketing by glueing the efforts in marketing and sales together with revenue - two historically disconnected entities - and it is a massive engineering challenge. Our technology provides transparency and enables insights for our customers into what works and what doesn't. It is a complicated task and requires a Python engineer with a passion for data processing.

As a team, we strongly believe in engaging closely with customers when developing our product. We also believe in shipping fast, meaning that most of the time we all have to accept that things are not perfect.

About The Team


We are a venture-backed startup just starting our growth journey
We are busy and growing the team and product very fast
We are an experienced team combining marketing, tech and product skills from two successful Danish growth companies
We love building products through close interaction with users and customers



About The Position


You will join a young company
You will join the platform team, working alongside the data science and application experience teams in product
You will be responsible for managing the infrastructure, helping our team scale services and enabling the team to move quickly
You will be responsible for the kubernetes cluster, deployment scripts, CI and best practices in that area
You will work with services deployed to and in the Google Cloud Platform
You will work with Temporal as a self-hosted solution
You will almost solely be working in the Go programming language



Requirements


You are a Go developer with a knack and/or interest in the infrastructure behind services. This is foremost a development role
You have worked with Kubernetes and/or you are interested becoming very proficient with it (we are using Google Kubernetes Engine)
You believe in pragmatic iterations and working with the tools that are possible and make sense
You know how to integrate into many different systems, and know your way around REST APIs both as constructor and consumer
It is a big plus if you have worked with technologies such as Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, Temporal
You enjoy learning new technologies as we use lots of the latest and greatest ones. Take a look at our https://stackshare.io/dreamdata/dreamdata profile for the full list



Benefits


A nice salary and, for the right candidate, equity
Lunch at the office
Work in the heart of Copenhagen
Getting to work with some of the best startup minds in Copenhagen
Great waterside location, close to Fisketorvet
Show more

  • You believe in pragmatic iterations and working with the tools that are possible and make sense
  • You know how to integrate into many different systems, and know your way around REST APIs both as constructor and consumer
  • It is a big plus if you have worked with technologies such as Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, Temporal
  • You enjoy learning new technologies as we use lots of the latest and greatest ones. Take a look at our https://stackshare.io/dreamdata/dreamdata profile for the full list


Benefits

  • A nice salary and, for the right candidate, equity
  • Lunch at the office
  • Work in the heart of Copenhagen
  • Getting to work with some of the best startup minds in Copenhagen
  • Great waterside location, close to Fisketorvet

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Er du en passioneret Data Scientist med en skarp forretningsforst√•else og evner til at skabe innovative algoritmer? S√• vil du elske at v√¶re en del af vores nyetablerede, specialiserede data-team. Vi lever og √•nder for data, algoritmer og avanceret statistik. Hvis du vil g√∏re en forskel for vores kunder gennem banebrydende l√∏sninger, er du pr√¶cis den, vi leder efter, som vores nye Data Scientist til vores hovedkontor i Aarhus.




Din hverdag

Som en del af vores voksende data-team arbejder du sammen med et team af kolleger med forskellig baggrund og kompetencer. Det, der binder jer sammen, er jeres store interesse for data, AI og forretningsudvikling ‚Äì og hvordan vi i Vertica kan hj√¶lpe vores kunder med at oms√¶tte data til vigtige indsigter, som kan v√¶re med til at flytte og styrke vores kunders forretning. Vertica er en h√∏jt specialiseret virksomhed med 140 medarbejdere fordelt p√• vores kontorer i hjertet af Aarhus og K√∏dbyen i K√∏benhavn. Vores kunder t√¶ller nogle af de st√∏rste og mest ambiti√∏se e-handelsvirksomheder i Danmark s√•som S√∏strene Grene, Br√∏drene Dahl, H√∏rkram og Louis Poulsen.




I din rolle kommer du med det rette data p√• det rette tidspunkt og i den rette kvalitet. Du skaber s√•ledes et st√¶rkt fundament for, at vores kunder har nem adgang til at arbejde med data og vigtigst af alt, at de kan s√¶tte handling bag data. Du er den f√∏rste i din rolle, og du vil derfor have rig mulighed for s√¶tte dit pr√¶g p√•, hvordan teamet skal udvikle sig og vokse fremover.




I din rolle vil du:

Designe, udvikle og implementere machine learning-modeller og algoritmer
Udforske og analysere store, komplekse datas√¶t for at identificere m√∏nstre og tendenser
Samarbejde med forskellige forretningsomr√•der for at forst√• deres behov og oms√¶tte data til strategiske indsigter
Kommunikere resultater og anbefalinger til b√•de tekniske og ikke-tekniske interessenter
Bidrage til at definere best practices og standarder for data science i organisationen




Dit fundament

St√¶rke programmeringsf√¶rdigheder i Python og erfaring med at udvikle i et Microsoft-milj√∏
Praktisk erfaring med machine learning og dataanalyse i Azure, herunder brug af tjenester som Azure Machine Learning og Azure Cognitive Services.
Dybtg√•ende forst√•else for statistik, sandsynlighedsteori og machine learning-teknikker
Erfaring med at arbejde med store datas√¶t og datavisualiseringsv√¶rkt√∏jer som f.eks. PowerBI
Evne til at formidle komplekse, tekniske koncepter til forskellige m√•lgrupper
Proaktiv og l√¶renem med en passion for at l√∏se udfordrende problemer
Erfaring med andre Microsoft-teknologier som Azure Data Factory, Azure Stream Analytics og Azure Data Lake er et plus men ikke et krav.
Kendskab til data engineering-opgaver, herunder ETL-processer, datamodellering og backendudvikling er et plus men ikke et krav.
Du taler flydende dansk og engelsk




Og nu til alt det, vi gerne vil tilbyde dig!




Gennemsigtighed er en af kernev√¶rdierne i Vertica, og derfor ligger vores personaleh√•ndbog frit tilg√¶ngeligt her. I personaleh√•ndbogen kan du l√¶se, hvilke vilk√•r vi - og alle vores fremtidige kolleger - arbejder under. Hvis ikke du har tid til at l√¶se hele h√•ndbogen igennem, s√• har vi fremh√¶vet nogle af dem, vi s√¶tter s√¶rligt pris p√•.




Livslang l√¶ring: Vi g√•r i livets skole, men af og til er der ogs√• kurser, konferencer eller uddannelser, som man kan l√¶re af. Er det noget du gerne vil blive klogere p√•, har du muligheden for at videreuddanne dig i Vertica. Vi har sat uddannelsesbudgettet frit.

Det sociale: Sociale arrangementer holder vi mange af. Det kan v√¶re alt fra klatring, padeltennis, byg-dit-eget-tastatur og cocktail-kursus til familietur i Djurs Sommerland. Derudover tager vi hvert √•r p√• en firmaweekend, hvor vi har fokus p√• hygge, god mad og socialt samv√¶r.




Hele mennesker p√• arbejde: Vi tror p√• at der er andet i livet end arbejde og derfor er det vigtigt for os at vi holder os inden for en 37-timers arbejdsuge.




Kan du se dig selv som en del af Vertica?

Lyder dette som et dr√∏mmejob? S√• send din ans√∏gning og CV hurtigst muligt.

Vi er klar over, at det er umuligt at give et fuldst√¶ndigt og retvisende billede af dig selv ud fra en ans√∏gning og CV alene, men indledningsvist er det desv√¶rre alt, vi har. Vi vil gerne l√¶re personen bag ans√∏gningen s√• godt at kende som muligt. Fort√¶l os derfor om din passion og dine v√¶rdier. Din historie og dine dr√∏mme. Og ikke mindst hvordan du er projektleder og dit syn p√• projektledelse.




Du er ogs√• velkommen til at kontakte Rasmus Lynggaard hvis du har sp√∏rgsm√•l, √∏nsker at h√∏re mere om stillingen eller aftale at bes√∏ge os i vores hyggelige lokaler ved √Öboulevarden 69. Rasmus kan kontaktes p√• rly@vertica.dk. OBS. Rasmus er p√• ferie, og er f√∏rst tilbage i uge 31.

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist
Description:
Would you like to be part of transforming a Finance organization with data and advanced analytics?‚ÄØDo you enjoy coding, designing, and implementing data science solutions for real world problems? Are you passionate about working in a multinational environment and partnering with business experts across the company globally?

If so, then we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our Advanced Analytics team in Business Finance, as a (Senior) Data Scientist. Apply today for a life-changing career!

The Position
As our (Senior) Data Scientist, you will be part of a team tasked with translating the requirements of use-cases from a business point of view, into advanced analytics solutions. This will be backed up by thorough and iterative data wrangling and model exploration.

Furthermore, you will be responsible to:



Drive the development of Machine Learning solutions, to enable sustainable data injection, data processing, Machine Learning modelling and outputs serving, aimed at providing business partners with actionable insights through Proof of Concept (PoC) and Minimum Viable Product (MVP)
Ensure analytics models and Machine Learning pipelines‚Äô interpretability and replicability
Improve our team‚Äôs efficiency by optimizing and automating current processes
Onboard stakeholders of our AI journey and together with the team, ensure derived insights are being applied to key business processes
Strengthen our in-house capabilities in the space of data science and the use of best technology practices through knowledge sharing with colleagues




The position is located in our HQ in Bagsv√¶rd (Greater Copenhagen area), with flexible working possibilities.

Qualifications

We are looking for a candidate who has:



+3 years of experience (5+ years for the Senior Data Scientist position) of hands-on experience within implementing data science solutions, Machine Learning & other Advanced Analytics projects, preferably in a corporate finance setting
Master of Science in Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics, Economics or similar.
Proficient knowledge and strong hands-on experience in developing and applying predictive and prescriptive modelling in Python is a must and familiarity with other programming languages is a plus
Data management knowledge (e.g. SQL) and SAP experience as a plus
Preferably, experience in cloud computing, e.g. Azure and data bricks and Azure Machine Learning
Ideally, fundamental knowledge of corporate finance




On a personal level, you have strong self-learning and communication skills, with ability to collaborate across business and technology functions. Furthermore, you are a team player and enjoy sparring with peers and co-workers to drive insights and provide recommendations on existing business process optimization.

About The Team / Department

The Advanced Analytics team is part of the BI & Advanced Analytics department in the global finance organization. We are a highly diverse team consisting of data scientists, BI developers, project managers, and partners from different countries. Our team is united by a shared drive to develop and deliver data-driven solutions to our stakeholders. With the growing demand for advanced analytics solutions, we are expanding our team to drive even more use-cases and accelerate the digitalization and AI ambition of the global finance organization.

Working at Novo Nordisk
We are a proud life-science company, and life is our reason to exist. We‚Äôre inspired by life in all its forms and shapes, ups and downs, opportunities and challenges. For employees at Novo Nordisk, life means many things ‚Äì from the building blocks of life that form the basis of ground-breaking scientific research, to our rich personal lives that motivate and energise us to perform our best at work. Ultimately, life is why we‚Äôre all here - to ensure that people can lead a life independent of chronic disease.

Contact
For further information, please contact Ling Feng Head of Advanced Analytics at LGFN@novonordisk.com.

Deadline
18 August 2024.

To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we‚Äôre life changing.

ASAP Start




100% Remote ‚Äì Ideally Nordic based professionals

Title: Back End Developer
Description:
Backend Developer - Construction Industry




Our client is currently expanding their team within backend development to accelerate development of a new innovative platform for the construction industry. The solution covers visualization, automation solutions and system integration for the construction industry.




As a backend developer you will be part of a cross functional team consisting of highly skilled

developers and engineers within software development, civil engineering and data analytics. It is a chance to be part of a skilled team with high ambitions to develop a cloud solution and create a successful international company.




Our client are a company with high ambitions, both in terms of growth and positive impact on the world around us and encourage their developers to be the same.




They are looking for a passionate software engineer who enjoys building innovative applications using modern technologies, and with the ability to understand 3D-modelling software used in the construction industry. It will include both DevOps and Backend development on the existing

development stack including Node JS and React JS, running on AWS.




Tech Stack




‚Ä¢ Node JS

‚Ä¢ DB-PostgreSQL

‚Ä¢ Core Java

‚Ä¢ General AWS platform

‚Ä¢ General Infrastructure

‚Ä¢ React JS

‚Ä¢ Elastic Search

‚Ä¢ Web services Administration




This role is based in north of Copenhagen in S√∏borg, please apply if you are interested üöÄ

Title: Experienced Data Scientist
Description:
Be a key player in the success of our cutting-edge product, SitaWare Insight.

AI is rapidly changing how complex raw data is turned into useful information, and information is what fuels the military intelligence process. For us, utilizing advanced algorithms on text, images, audio, video, and real-time geo-positional data gives our customers an advantage on the battlefield. This is what saves lives and helps win the battle.

SitaWare Insight is a decision support tool that uses AI to convert data into invaluable military intelligence. This involves transforming data into information, providing commanders with advanced data capture and analysis capabilities, and leveraging technologies such as machine learning.

The team
You will become part of a Scrum team of 11 highly skilled and competent colleagues in Denmark. From day one, you will be met with a collaborative and dynamic environment where you can develop your competencies.

Our mission for the team is to advance toward an operational AI platform. Currently, we service AI models such as LLM for text and audio, the latest deep learning models for images and videos and custom models for time series. Still, we aspire to elevate these models to the next level of maturity through improved generalization, scalability, and efficiency of our platform.

In short, you can look forward to:


Developing high-quality machine learning models to enhance decision support
Collaborating with MLOps for the seamless integration of models
Contributing to the growth, improvement, and maintenance of SitaWare Insight



Experienced Data Scientist
We are looking for an experienced data scientist to work on a broad spectrum of data science tasks, including model development and model deployment. We expect that you are passionate about transforming data into actionable insights and that you bring:


Proven product development experience as a Data Scientist with knowledge and experience with LLM and NLP methods
Minimum of a Master's or Ph.D. in a relevant field (e.g., Cognitive Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science).
Demonstrated expertise in developing and implementing machine learning models
Strong programming skills in Python and popular ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Transformers, Tensorflow
Proficiency in data preprocessing and feature engineering
Computer science skills supporting the overall development of the data science service
Solid understanding of data handling, model evaluation, visualization of data-driven solutions and development of best-practices
Appreciate teamwork and sparring with colleagues
Great communication skills
Proficient in English



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which offers almost 100 events of both social and professional character a year ‚Äì plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves various delicious and healthy dishes daily. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Preben Schmidt Nielsen, Senior Project Manager.

Please be aware that response times may be longer due to summer holidays.

Get in touch

Mette M√∏rch Rasmussen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant


Show more

SitaWare Insight is a decision support tool that uses AI to convert data into invaluable military intelligence. This involves transforming data into information, providing commanders with advanced data capture and analysis capabilities, and leveraging technologies such as machine learning.

The team
You will become part of a Scrum team of 11 highly skilled and competent colleagues in Denmark. From day one, you will be met with a collaborative and dynamic environment where you can develop your competencies.

Our mission for the team is to advance toward an operational AI platform. Currently, we service AI models such as LLM for text and audio, the latest deep learning models for images and videos and custom models for time series. Still, we aspire to elevate these models to the next level of maturity through improved generalization, scalability, and efficiency of our platform.

In short, you can look forward to:

  • Developing high-quality machine learning models to enhance decision support
  • Collaborating with MLOps for the seamless integration of models
  • Contributing to the growth, improvement, and maintenance of SitaWare Insight


Experienced Data Scientist
We are looking for an experienced data scientist to work on a broad spectrum of data science tasks, including model development and model deployment. We expect that you are passionate about transforming data into actionable insights and that you bring:

  • Proven product development experience as a Data Scientist with knowledge and experience with LLM and NLP methods
  • Minimum of a Master's or Ph.D. in a relevant field (e.g., Cognitive Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science).
  • Demonstrated expertise in developing and implementing machine learning models
  • Strong programming skills in Python and popular ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Transformers, Tensorflow
  • Proficiency in data preprocessing and feature engineering
  • Computer science skills supporting the overall development of the data science service
  • Solid understanding of data handling, model evaluation, visualization of data-driven solutions and development of best-practices
  • Appreciate teamwork and sparring with colleagues
  • Great communication skills
  • Proficient in English


Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which offers almost 100 events of both social and professional character a year ‚Äì plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves various delicious and healthy dishes daily. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Preben Schmidt Nielsen, Senior Project Manager.

Please be aware that response times may be longer due to summer holidays.

Get in touch

Mette M√∏rch Rasmussen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant

Title: Data Scientist - Vejle
Place: Vejle, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Scientist - Vejle:

Do you thrive in a technology forward environment where everyone contributes towards the evolution of the team and business?

Then this could be your next role.

This business has been on an organic growth journey thanks to success year on year.

With a team of now 30+ across Vejle and Copenhagen, they have built a genuine development driven community where team members get to be autonomous and drive their own solutions.

After successfully adding new team members in software development, platform engineering and data engineering - we are now looking for our next data scientist.

As our new data scientist you will be responsible for one of our data driven products, taking ownership of the solution. Working on end-end development:


Gathering analysis requirements from internal stakeholders and team members
Guiding and advising on how it can be improved through new machine learning models
Designing, building, testing and deploying new solutions
Sharing knowledge with the team and business about the new features


To be able to succeed in this, we imagine you have the following:


Previous professional experience and proven track record in developing machine learning models
Expert using Python, Pandas, NumPy, etc.
Experience in SQL
Familiarity with software development tools such as git, Docker and agile processes
Experience in Neural Networks, Deep Learning, and Tree-Based learners
Strong understanding of both traditional statistical modelling and machine learning
Excellent proficiency in English, both verbally and written


By joining this team you are giving yourself the chance to really deep dive into your passions, this business knows that if it is to continue to grow it needs new insights and perspectives.

If you want freedom to geek out, then here it is!

d.nichol@nigelfrank.com

Title: Senior AI/ML Engineer
Description:
OLSYS provides full-service solutions for mid-market and enterprise organizations.

With 15+ years of experience, 100+ projects, and 50+ strong technical experts in the team, we continue to grow by expanding our development team in Europe, as well as expanding the base of new clients and projects.

As an enterprise software development company, we are building long-term partnerships helping our clients accelerate their digital experiences with reasonable IT investments.

Our tailored approach, e-commerce focus, and flexible solutions allow us to design, develop, and deliver scalable, integrated commerce platforms that drive profits and boost the business.

Our Industry Focus

‚Äî Banking and Finance (business continuity management, planning system, banking app development);

‚Äî Retail and E-Commerce (B2B Commerce, B2C Commerce, Digital/E-Commerce customer experience);

‚Äî Healthcare (website development for Healthcare organizations).

Our Expertise Includes

‚Äî Commerce Solutions

‚Äî Development Services

‚Äî Creative Services

‚Äî Quality Assurance and Testing

‚Äî Maintenance and Support

‚Äî E-Commerce Consulting

The Role

Responsibilities


Interact with the modern LLMs and adopt the best practices of their usage.
R&D activities (experimenting with LLMs): Generate code based on the input description. Build test cases based on the user scenarios.
Performance Monitoring: Monitor the performance of the models and make adjustments as necessary to maintain or enhance model accuracy and efficiency.
Data Preprocessing and Annotation: Work with the Data Engineering team to preprocess and annotate the training data for AI/ML models. Collaborate with subject matter experts to create labeled datasets that facilitate supervised and unsupervised learning.
Prototyping and Evaluation: Rapidly prototype and iterate different AI/ML approaches to identify the most suitable solution to meet the requirements.


Perform rigorous evaluations to measure the model's performance against defined metrics.


Documentation: Document all stages of the AI/ML development process, including design choices, architecture, algorithms, and evaluation results, ensuring knowledge transfer and team understanding.
Collaboration: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Data Scientists and Software Engineers.
Stay Abreast of Industry Trends: Keep up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI/ML, NLP, LLM and other relevant technologies. Integrate new research findings and methodologies into the project as applicable.


Ideal Profile


Experience: Demonstrated experience of at least 5 years in developing AI/ML solutions with a focus on LLM and LLM frameworks (e.g. LangChain). Strong knowledge and practical experience in Generative AI, Interactive Chatbots, Graph databases.
Data Processing: Experience in preprocessing and handling large-scale, unstructured text data, and the ability to perform data analysis and validation.
Problem-solving and Innovation: Proven ability to tackle complex technical challenges, think innovatively, and propose creative solutions to real-world problems.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


English level: Upper-Intermediate

What's on Offer?


You can contribute and influence the development of a new product
Work with AI product
Flexible working options
Show more

Title: Senior Frontend Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you an experienced Frontend Engineer looking for a new challenge?




A long-standing Copenhagen-based client of ours are growing their Frontend team.




Their platform is sold across Denmark to a wide range of financial outfits, consultancies, and architects; allowing them to better understand property data.




What we can offer:




A chance to join a progressive, growing business in a growing sector
The chance to have REAL impact & influence over the Frontend
An amazing culture, amongst some super talented colleagues
A platform where you can have a voice, where the best opinion wins




What are we looking for?




5+ Years professional coding experience, primarily in Frontend
A true "Senior" - both in terms of technical ability, but also mindset
Someone that wants to take on more responsibility, be involved in code reviews & coaching
Vue experience (ideally) or at least the desire to learn the framework




The business has recently moved into a much larger premises in Copenhagen, which is a huge vote of confidence; as well as providing them the necessary room to grow (literally!).




Hybrid based in Copenhagen, salary up to 60,000DKK

Title: Python Application Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a Python developer eager to dive into the world of neurotechnology and AI within a startup setting? Affecture is searching for someone like you!

In this role, you would be responsible for building an application to be used internally at Affecture. This tool will be used to record, synchronize, display, and manage EEG, GSR, and PPG data, enhancing our capabilities in running biometric user research smoothly. Python will be used to build the tool, so proficiency in the language is mandatory. Frameworks such as NiceGUI or PySide6 will be used to build the graphical user interface. Experience with these frameworks is not required, however, it would be beneficial. On top of that, previous experience with UI design, time series data, or more specifically biometric data is a plus.

Affecture is a Copenhagen-based startup that offers game user research services to video game studios, incorporating traditional playtest methods and enhanced analysis using insights extracted from physiological data from the brain, heart, and skin. At Affecture, you will be surrounded by a team dedicated to UX, neurotechnology, and AI, providing you with the necessary resources and collaboration opportunities to apply and grow your skill set.

Our internship is flexible and doesn't require university enrolment, allowing you to join us whenever it suits you. The duration of this internship would be around two months, but we are open to adjustments to fit your schedule.

Title: Internship at SDU best startup nominee
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for talent to help us develop our first mobile application. The app will be developed with our CTO (Oliver) who currently studies a masters in software engineering. Furthermore, you will be advised by experts at LittleGiants in Odense, who has a rich history in app-development.

We are looking for students to join as interns, for an internship which will improve your skills and learnings as a programmer. The specific program tasks will be coordinated with Oliver, but experience or interest in Flutter, backend in NestJS (Python, Typescript, MongoDB) or web NextJS is desired.

Depending on future fundraising, potentiel jobs can be obtained after intern periods if a mutual match is considered.

For more information or questions please contact us at Lukas@carboplanner.com

Title: Senior Machine Learning Solutions Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
There is no quality healthcare without a quality dialogue. Today, that dialogue is broken; we need you to help us fix it.

Doctors and nurses across the world are facing unprecedented challenges. When we meet them, they're dealing with heavy workloads, extensive paperwork, and the pressure of performing well, which in healthcare, can have dire consequences. This system is gradually undermining the passion and autonomy of our dedicated healthcare professionals, who entered this field to provide care, not to clerk.

Corti has built the world's premier AI assistant for healthcare providers. It listens in during patient dialogue, takes notes, writes summaries, journals and does quality assurance. When information is missed, or risk is high, it offers nudges and prompts to help steer the dialogue back on the right path. Entire countries trust Corti to deliver better healthcare, and our AI has already helped millions of patients, but we are just getting started.

About the roleIn this role, you will act as a trusted advisor to prospective and existing customers. You will also work directly with our sales team, product team and ML Engineering team to provide value-based evaluation scenarios including demonstrations, labs, and POVs, to aid in closing business. You will sit at the intersection of product, sales and engineering and will work with the broader team to continue building the world's premier AI assistant for healthcare providers.

In This Role, You‚Äôll


Own the technical aspects of the sales cycle, designing and leading a tailored and business value-aligned technology evaluation process
Act as a customer-facing technical resource during customer / partner meetings and technology evaluations, working with Data Scientists, AI/ML practitioners, Architects, Technologists and Product owners.
Serve as an advisor on AI to help customers with their end-to-end vision; AI strategy, operating model & architectural best practices, problem framing, data preparation, scripting, model building, model deployment, model management, and output consumption.
Interpret complex problems, create simple solutions and collaborate closely with prospects, channel partners and our sales team to deliver winning solutions that help customers to accelerate critical business outcomes with AI.
Collaborate and maintain a close working relationship with product, engineering, sales, and marketing


You‚Äôll Thrive In This Role If You Have


Experience in customer facing technical roles (can include sales at a B2B software company or DS/ML consulting)
Expertise in modern machine learning frameworks and technologies (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, transformers)
Knowledge of industry standard technologies in the Data Science and Machine Learning space
Fluency with scripting in Python
Hands-on experience building and implementing machine learning or AI models
Experience collaborating with business stakeholders to ensure that machine learning solutions deliver successfully on business outcomes
Ability to connect a customer's specific business problems to Snorkel‚Äôs differentiated platform and unique approach to ML development.University degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or related fields, or equivalent experience preferred


What We Measure Success On


Customer Impact and Satisfaction: Measure success based on the positive impact Corti's AI has on healthcare providers and their patients. This is quantified through customer satisfaction surveys, Net Promoter Scores (NPS), and the number of patient outcomes positively influenced by Corti's technology.
Technical Solution Efficacy: Success is measured by the reduction in workload for healthcare professionals, the accuracy and relevancy of the AI's notes and summaries, and the efficiency of risk identification and management.
Sales and Business Growth: Contribution to business growth through new customer acquisition, retention rates, and the expansion of Corti's services within existing accounts. Measure the role's impact on closing deals and generating revenue.
Innovation and Continuous Improvement: Measured by the ability to contribute to the ongoing enhancement of Corti's AI technology. This includes introducing new features, improving model accuracy, and adopting best practices in AI development and deployment.


Practicalities


You will work from our office in Copenhagen (hybrid).
You will be part of several yearly trips including our annual Corticon event.
You will join a multinational team passionate about revolutionizing healthcare.
You will never have had more driven or passionate colleagues before.
You will never ever be bored.


Who Are You As a Person


You are energized by purpose.
You prefer truths over comfortable illusions.
You don‚Äôt want a job where you watch the clock, but one where you make it count.
You are looking for a community of people equally as dedicated.
You embrace the pace of startup life.


Ready to dive into the world of Corti? Hit that 'Apply' button, and let's start working together on reshaping the dialogue in healthcare, making a real difference for millions of patient outcomes around the world.

ü§ù Bringing in top talent from all backgrounds is crucial in our pursuit to improve the world of healthcare. We encourage applications from all people and do not discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, and/or disability status.Ôªø

At Corti, experience comes in many forms, and we‚Äôre passionate about creating teams with a multitude of perspectives! If you believe your experience is close to what we‚Äôre looking for but not an exact match, we still hope you‚Äôll consider applying!
Show more

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Bredebro, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you interested in playing a key part in shaping the future of automation solutions at one of Denmark‚Äôs largest brands? Are you seeking a role that enables you to collaborate with a team driven by substantial technical aspirations, working on the development of cutting-edge production technology in the market?




At ECCO's HQ facilities in Bredebro, you will join the Factory 2025 department, where you will be an integral part of a dynamic software team, working collaboratively to devise and establish ECCO‚Äôs factories of tomorrow.




Engineering for the future

Stepping into this role, you will take part in developing and standardizing future production technologies and equipment, so it can be rolled out globally. This involves designing, specifying, testing, and validating the production equipment and control concepts, as well as standardising the software architecture and programming of equipment to ensure operational stability.

The type of production technology you will work with spans from process automation, involving programming of robots and sensorics, to intralogistics, involving programming of PLCs, AGVs and product transportation technologies.

You will also have the chance to explore uncharted domains, where definitive answers regarding efficacy or accuracy may not always be readily accessible. Therefore, being passionate about crafting ideal solutions and continually expanding your knowledge and skill set, are something we are looking for in our next colleague.




Your tasks include:

PLC programming (structured text) / robot programming
Implementation of sensors for production processes (vision, 2D/3D scanning, etc.)
Recipe development (process implementation)
Development, installation, commissioning, and maintenance of equipment
Documentation of technical solutions and procedures




Solid experience with automation solutions

You like to take responsibility and do not shy away from a challenge. You demonstrate a swift comprehension of advanced programming, and you are known for being out-going, proactive and having a self-motivated approach to tasks. It is also vital that you bring a thorough understand of project management, whether they are straightforward or complex. Moreover, we imagine that you:




Bring a technical education in a relevant field (e.g. Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, Engineering, etc.)
Have knowledge of industrial automation equipment, such as PLC (Beckhoff and Siemens) , loT, gateway etc.
Are experienced in controlling actual hardware (robot, actuator, etc.) based on sensed information
Are familiar with online and offline robot programming in ABB
Have experience with electrical troubleshooting
Can develop algorithms or control software in Python, Java or C++
Have knowledge in fieldbus network, Machine-to-Machine (M2M protocols )
Are proficient in version control (GIT) (it is advantageous)




Are you ready for your next challenge?

PULS Human Relations is the recruitment partner for this position. If you would like to know more about the position you are welcome to contact:




Michael Natapon Hansson, Senior Architect - Robotics & Control, ECCO: +45 2128 1986

Or

Henrik Selmer Steffensen, Recruitment Partner, PULS Human Relations: +45 43144212




After receiving and reviewing your application, we will contact you regarding the next steps in the process. We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so please send your application as soon as possible.

Apply via the link below.

We look forward to hearing from you!

CREATE THE FOOTPRINTS OF TOMORROW

At ECCO, you become part of a meaningful, developing, and multicultural workplace. You join a global family of more than 25,000 people who are proud to create the footprints of tomorrow.

Headquartered in Denmark, we are a family-owned company that offers international opportunities. Our offices and facilities have an informal culture and relaxed dress code ‚Äì our shoe code is slightly stricter.

Join us and we guarantee lifelong learning ‚Äì the speed of progress is up to you. So, if you‚Äôre curious, passionate, and ready to make an impact, you‚Äôll fit right in.

Show more
HTML:
Are you interested in playing a key part in shaping the future of automation solutions at one of Denmark‚Äôs largest brands? Are you seeking a role that enables you to collaborate with a team driven by substantial technical aspirations, working on the development of cutting-edge production technology in the market?


At ECCO's HQ facilities in Bredebro, you will join the Factory 2025 department, where you will be an integral part of a dynamic software team, working collaboratively to devise and establish ECCO‚Äôs factories of tomorrow.


Engineering for the future

Stepping into this role, you will take part in developing and standardizing future production technologies and equipment, so it can be rolled out globally. This involves designing, specifying, testing, and validating the production equipment and control concepts, as well as standardising the software architecture and programming of equipment to ensure operational stability.

The type of production technology you will work with spans from process automation, involving programming of robots and sensorics, to intralogistics, involving programming of PLCs, AGVs and product transportation technologies.

You will also have the chance to explore uncharted domains, where definitive answers regarding efficacy or accuracy may not always be readily accessible. Therefore, being passionate about crafting ideal solutions and continually expanding your knowledge and skill set, are something we are looking for in our next colleague.


Your tasks include:

  • PLC programming (structured text) / robot programming
  • Implementation of sensors for production processes (vision, 2D/3D scanning, etc.)
  • Recipe development (process implementation)
  • Development, installation, commissioning, and maintenance of equipment
  • Documentation of technical solutions and procedures


Solid experience with automation solutions

You like to take responsibility and do not shy away from a challenge. You demonstrate a swift comprehension of advanced programming, and you are known for being out-going, proactive and having a self-motivated approach to tasks. It is also vital that you bring a thorough understand of project management, whether they are straightforward or complex. Moreover, we imagine that you:


  • Bring a technical education in a relevant field (e.g. Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, Engineering, etc.)
  • Have knowledge of industrial automation equipment, such as PLC (Beckhoff and Siemens) , loT, gateway etc.
  • Are experienced in controlling actual hardware (robot, actuator, etc.) based on sensed information
  • Are familiar with online and offline robot programming in ABB
  • Have experience with electrical troubleshooting
  • Can develop algorithms or control software in Python, Java or C++
  • Have knowledge in fieldbus network, Machine-to-Machine (M2M protocols )
  • Are proficient in version control (GIT) (it is advantageous)


Are you ready for your next challenge?

PULS Human Relations is the recruitment partner for this position. If you would like to know more about the position you are welcome to contact:


Michael Natapon Hansson, Senior Architect - Robotics & Control, ECCO: +45 2128 1986

Or

Henrik Selmer Steffensen, Recruitment Partner, PULS Human Relations: +45 43144212


After receiving and reviewing your application, we will contact you regarding the next steps in the process. We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so please send your application as soon as possible.

Apply via the link below.

We look forward to hearing from you!

CREATE THE FOOTPRINTS OF TOMORROW

At ECCO, you become part of a meaningful, developing, and multicultural workplace. You join a global family of more than 25,000 people who are proud to create the footprints of tomorrow.

Headquartered in Denmark, we are a family-owned company that offers international opportunities. Our offices and facilities have an informal culture and relaxed dress code ‚Äì our shoe code is slightly stricter.

Join us and we guarantee lifelong learning ‚Äì the speed of progress is up to you. So, if you‚Äôre curious, passionate, and ready to make an impact, you‚Äôll fit right in.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copyright Agent emerged from a deep-rooted respect for people - writers, photographers, and creators of all kinds - who have the talent and courage to be original. We work with content creators across Europe, North and South America, New Zealand, and Australia to manage and protect their intellectual property - mostly images and videos - from unlicensed use.

Why join Copyright Agent you might ask?

We are 20 people, with roots from all over the world, genuinely passionate about safeguarding the ecosystem of originality. We are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Data Scientist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of data science techniques, strong analytical skills, and the ability to lead complex projects from conception to completion. This role requires both technical expertise and the ability to communicate insights effectively to drive business outcomes.

Key Responsibilities


Advanced Data Analysis:
Utilize advanced statistical methods, machine learning, and artificial intelligence techniques to analyze complex datasets.
Develop and implement predictive models and algorithms to solve business problems and drive decision-making.
Project Leadership:
Lead data science projects, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and meet business objectives.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, finance, and sales, to integrate data science solutions seamlessly into business processes.
Technical Development:
Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and models.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in data science and AI, integrating new methodologies as appropriate.
Optimize and refine models to improve their performance and accuracy.
Communication & Collaboration:
Communicate complex data science concepts and results to non-technical stakeholders clearly and concisely.
Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand their needs and how data science can provide value.
Advocate for a data-driven culture within the organization.

Required Qualifications


A bachelor's or master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in data science or a related field.
Proven track record of delivering successful data science projects.
Strong expertise in machine learning, statistical analysis, and predictive modeling.
Proficiency in programming and query languages such as Python and SQL.
Experience with big data technologies and cloud platforms (preferably GCP, others applicable).
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas to various audiences.


Preferred Qualifications


Familiarity with data visualization tools (Looker Studio and BigQuery preferred, Power BI, Tableau etc. applicable).
Strong understanding of data governance and best practices in data management.


Expectations


Innovation & Continuous Improvement: Continuously explore new techniques and tools to enhance the data science function.
Project Execution: Deliver high-quality data science projects that provide actionable insights and drive business outcomes.
Business Impact: Demonstrate the tangible impact of data science initiatives on business performance and strategy.
Ethical Considerations: Ensure that all data science practices adhere to ethical standards and comply with relevant regulations.


Ready to join our team here at Copyright Agent?

At Copyright Agent, we believe in fostering innovation and driving excellence. We are dedicated to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive and contribute to our shared success. By joining us, you will have access to continuous learning opportunities and a vibrant work culture that values creativity and collaboration.

If this sounds interesting - then we would love to hear from you!

For more information or questions please contact us at emma@copyrightagent.com

Title: Senior AI Engineer (OpenAI)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:

Delegate er et IT-konsulenthus i v√¶kst, hvor st√¶rke v√¶rdier og h√∏j faglighed er grundlaget for din og vores udvikling og succes. Delegate og TDN (The Digital Neighborhood) har valgt at satse massivt p√• udviklingen af robuste og cutting edge AI l√∏sninger, hvorfor vi f√•r brug for endnu en st√¶rk profil indenfor AI engineering med Azure OpenAI.

Dine tekniske kvalifikationer:

Krav:

Ekspert i Python-udvikling
Erfaring med
Azure App Service
Azure Functions
Azure DevOps-pipelines og Bicep/IAC.
JSON/Rest API-integration




Plusser:

Erfaring med:

Azure Cost Estimation
Automatiseret test ud over unit tests
Erfaring, uddannelse eller interesse for klassisk maskinl√¶ring




Professionelle f√¶rdigheder

Erfaring med tidsestimering og dokumentation af komplekse opgaver
Taler og skriver dansk og engelsk.




Work from anywhere

Vi g√∏r meget ud af at skabe rammerne for at kunne balancere arbejdsliv og privatliv. I Delegate har du fuld fleksibilitet til at planl√¶gge din hverdag, s√• du f.eks. kan hente b√∏rnene tidligt, eller l√¶gge din tr√¶ning midt p√• dagen, for til geng√¶ld at √•bne computeren p√• et andet tidspunkt, ligesom du har mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra. Vi kalder det #workfromanywhere. Vi er forpligtet over for hinanden og vores kunder, og derfor stoler vi p√•, at du ogs√• anerkender den betydelige v√¶rdi af at m√∏de ind p√• vores fysiske kontor i l√∏bet af ugen.




Velkommen hjem

Hos Delegate bliver du m√∏dt med n√¶rv√¶r og kvalitet p√• alle niveauer, og vi tager os tid til at hj√¶lpe hinanden og g√∏r os umage for, at b√•de kunder og kollegaer f√∏ler sig hjemme. Her kan du udvikle dig i et st√¶rkt f√¶llesskab, hvor du f√•r faglig sparring med dygtige kollegaer, som har lige s√• h√∏je standarder for l√∏sninger som dig. Samarbejdet med vores kunder er kendetegnet ved gode og afslappede relationer med en √•ben dialog, hvor kundens team er trygge ved at fort√¶lle dig om behov og udfordringer, fordi de ved, at du s√¶tter en √¶re i at l√∏se dem.




Nysgerrig?

Du m√• meget gerne booke et uforpligtende og uformelt kaffem√∏de med Julie Lindvald Thorsen her, hvis du vil h√∏re mere eller har sp√∏rgsm√•l, inden du s√∏ger.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:

Praktisk erfaring med machine learning og dataanalyse i Azure, herunder brug af tjenester som Azure Machine Learning og Azure Cognitive Services.
Dybtg√•ende forst√•else for statistik, sandsynlighedsteori og machine learning-teknikker
Erfaring med at arbejde med store datas√¶t og datavisualiseringsv√¶rkt√∏jer som f.eks. PowerBI
Evne til at formidle komplekse, tekniske koncepter til forskellige m√•lgrupper
Proaktiv og l√¶renem med en passion for at l√∏se udfordrende problemer
Erfaring med andre Microsoft-teknologier som Azure Data Factory, Azure Stream Analytics og Azure Data Lake er et plus men ikke et krav.
Kendskab til data engineering-opgaver, herunder ETL-processer, datamodellering og backendudvikling er et plus men ikke et krav.
Du taler flydende dansk og engelsk

Hele mennesker p√• arbejde: Vi tror p√• at der er andet i livet end arbejde og derfor er det vigtigt for os at vi holder os inden for en 37-timers arbejdsuge.

Title: Data scientist - Digital transformation
Place: H√∏rsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Scientist ‚Äì Digital transformation

Are you ready to drive innovation/development and improve our digital data products, specifically in the realm of Supply Chain and Production data in a global context? Can you envision yourself at the forefront of accelerating data science and digital innovation initiatives, crafting data products from proofs of concept to full-scale production implementation.

You‚Äôll be joining a diverse and international team. We‚Äôre on a mission, working closely together as a team developing solutions that can support decision makers and the business. Right now we are 6 data enthusiast, on the Digital transformation team, but we are looking to scale the team to meet the challenge and create a bigger and stronger team. The team consists of Digital Product Owners who engages directly with the business. Other colleagues are working on data analysis and ML/AI research.

Join us, in getting hands-on with AI in manufacturing and support the progress for the product team in an agile way.

Your Challenges

Your responsibilities will revolve around the development and maintenance of the standardized and scalable data solutions across Supply on existing Data and AI Platform . You ensure world class data quality deliverables, operationalized and adopted in the business across value streams.

You will support the Digital product owner team and Operations in the delivery of high data quality from ‚Äúuser stories‚Äù using agile mgmt. approaches.

In More Detail Your Primary Tasks Will Be To


Apply state-of-the-art methods within statistical analysis, programming, and visualization to generate insights and knowledge from our large and diverse data sources
Develop and maintain the standardized and scalable data solutions across Supply on existing Data and AI Platform
Ensure world class data quality deliverables, operationalized and adopted in the organization across value streams
Identify, analyse and scope business requirements in collaboration with business stakeholders and our external partners
Design and execute actionable data, controlled and monitoring, based on business requirements
Technical guidance: Leverage technical knowledge to make informed decisions about product features, technical feasibility, architecture, and integrations


In this role you will be working in our head office in H√∏rsholm, reporting to the Head of Digital Transformation Supply.

Your Qualifications

To thrive in this role, you should have a good business acumen, great communication skills, and a collaborative mindset.

You hold a Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent degree (e.g. within Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science or Data Science). Your creative problem-solving, time management, and keen attention to emerging data trends are also key strengths for success in this position.

Moreover, We Expect That You Have


Proven ability to report complex information easily to people with various technical capabilities
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to manage large sets of data and present results in a simple manner
Advanced dashboard development (Using Plotly/Dash or similar and PowerBi)
3+ years of experience in uncovering data insights to form hypotheses, evaluating results, and making recommendations
Experience in operationalising and running Data Products including ML and MLOps on Microsoft Azure.
Have a genuine passion for understanding data and the story behind it.
Experience from global organization e.g. in the area of manufacturing will be preferable.
You are fluent in written and spoken English.


Your Opportunities

You will be part of a dynamic and business-oriented team, which is characterised by an informal tone and a healthy sense of humor.

Learn more about the VELUX Group online at www.velux.com, where you can read more about working at our company and what to expect of our recruitment process.

We are looking forward to receiving your application and CV as soon as possible. We will be out on vacation in July but will be looking forward to reviewing your application once we‚Äôre back from vacation.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Br√¶nder du for AI and Analytics? Og vil du v√¶re med til at udvikle og drifte pr√¶diktive modeller, udf√∏re eksperimentelle analyser, og optimere eksisterende applikationer?

S√• er du den Data Scientist vi s√∏ger til vores team, AI og Data Science. AI st√•r h√∏jt p√• agendaen i Tryg og derfor har vi behov for flere dygtige Data Scientists til at underst√∏tte de mange sp√¶ndende initiativer.

Om os | Bred kontaktflade og fuld fokus p√• samarbejde

AI og Data Science teamet sidder sammen med Data & BI afdelingen, som servicerer og underst√∏tter vores Skadesforretning i Danmark med de rigtige data- og AI l√∏sninger til effektiv driftsstyring, √∏get digitalisering, kundeoplevelser, kvalitetssikring og procesoptimering.

Du vil blive en del af et relativt nyt AI og Data Science team, med et st√¶rkt fagligt milj√∏, hvor der konstant er fokus p√• at sikre en kontinuerlig udvikling. Vi har h√∏jt engagement, masser af gode ideer og god stemning.

Fordi vi er en afdeling best√•ende af flere teams med mange forskellige kompetencer, har vi har et stort fokus p√• sparring med hinanden, kompetenceudvikling samt et godt socialt arbejdsmilj√∏ ‚Äì der g√∏r arbejdsdagen sjovere og nemmere.

Vi l√¶gger stor v√¶gt p√• et samarbejde p√• tv√¶rs af afdelinger og funktioner, og du vil som Data Scientist i AI & Data Science teamet have et t√¶t samarbejde med kollegaer og vores Tryg Data Scientist community. Gennem samarbejde med forskellige kollegaer og samarbejdspartnere bliver du rustet med et solidt netv√¶rk, som s√¶tter dig i stand til at l√∏se dine opgaver bedre og hurtigere, og som samtidig sikrer en kontinuerlig udvikling af dine kompetencer. Det er en foruds√¶tning, at du har en naturlig tilgang til samarbejde med forskellige kollegaer, og ser det som en del af dit arbejde at s√∏ge viden og sparre med andre kollegaer.

Om jobbet | Operational Analytics & Data Science

Som Data Scientist kommer du til at have mange forskellige opgaver inden for AI & Analytics og Data Science. Det betyder, at du bl.a. vil arbejde med udvikling og drift af pr√¶diktive modeller, A/B testing, webservices og cloud computing. Fokus er at skabe v√¶rdi, og derfor kan l√∏sningen i nogle tilf√¶lde v√¶re simple regler og i andre tilf√¶lde mere avancerede statistiske modeller.

Tryg har en ambiti√∏s AI og data strategi og arbejder m√•lrettet for at etablere en Cloud baseret data- og analyseplatform, s√• det bliver hurtigere og nemmere at sikre tilg√¶ngeligheden af data, forbedre processer og sikre de rigtige v√¶rkt√∏jer.

Dine arbejdsopgaver som Data Scientist vil typisk v√¶re:


Udvikle og tr√¶ne pr√¶diktive modeller
Drifte modeller og applikationer i et cloud milj√∏
Integrere datakilder i nye og eksisterende applikationer
Effektm√•ling via monitorering og A/B testing
Udvikle services til interaktion og overv√•gning af applikationer
Udvikle og arbejde med GenAI og LLM


De vigtigste v√¶rkt√∏jer, som vi benytter, er bl.a. Microsoft Azure med Python, MLflow, Kubernetes, Docker, GitLab, Kafka og SQL, men vi er meget √•bne for at tage nye teknologier i brug.

Om dig | Skarp Data Scientist med fokus p√• v√¶rdiskabende Data Science l√∏sninger

Vi forventer, at du har en relevant uddannelse inden for Computer Science, Datalogi, Statistik, Matematik eller tilsvarende. Derudover er det en fordel, hvis du har hands-on erfaring med end-to-en Machine Learning processen, der bl.a. omfatter:


Databehandling
Model udvikling
Implementering og monitorering af modeller i produktion


Der er en forventning om, at du har kendskab til de mest almindelige Data Science v√¶rkt√∏jer og sprog, og som et minimum er flydende i Python. Udover Python, s√• benytter vi Kubernetes, Microsoft Azure, MLflow, Docker, GitLab, Kafka, SQL mv. og et kendskab til disse vil v√¶re en fordel.

Vigtigst af alt er dog, at du br√¶nder at g√∏re en forskel gennem udvikling af pr√¶diktive modeller og eksperimentelle analyser sammen med os!

Vi ser frem til at h√∏re fra dig!

Har du sp√∏rgsm√•l eller √∏nsker at vide mere, er du velkommen til at kontakte Head of Data & BI, Anette Schr√∏der Mikkelsen via mail: anette.m@tryg.dk .

Vi forpligter os til en retf√¶rdig og inkluderende rekrutteringsproces med lige muligheder for alle. I den forbindelse opfordrer vi til, at du undlader at inkludere et foto i dit CV. ‚ÄØ

Vi indkalder til samtaler fra august.

Ans√∏gningsfrist: d. 19. august 2024.

Tryg er Skandinaviens st√∏rste skadesforsikringsselskab med aktiviteter i Danmark, Norge og Sverige. I Danmark best√•r koncernen blandt andet af Tryg, Alka, TJM og Tryg Garanti. TryghedsGruppen er hovedejer af Tryg-koncernen og st√•r bag TrygFonden. Sammen arbejder vi hver dag, p√• hver vores m√•de, for at g√∏re danskernes hverdag mere tryg. Se mere p√• www.tryg.dk
