Du vil blive en del af et relativt nyt AI og Data Science team, med et st√¶rkt fagligt milj√∏, hvor der konstant er fokus p√• at sikre en kontinuerlig udvikling. Vi har h√∏jt engagement, masser af gode ideer og god stemning.

Fordi vi er en afdeling best√•ende af flere teams med mange forskellige kompetencer, har vi har et stort fokus p√• sparring med hinanden, kompetenceudvikling samt et godt socialt arbejdsmilj√∏ ‚Äì der g√∏r arbejdsdagen sjovere og nemmere.

Vi l√¶gger stor v√¶gt p√• et samarbejde p√• tv√¶rs af afdelinger og funktioner, og du vil som Data Scientist i AI & Data Science teamet have et t√¶t samarbejde med kollegaer og vores Tryg Data Scientist community. Gennem samarbejde med forskellige kollegaer og samarbejdspartnere bliver du rustet med et solidt netv√¶rk, som s√¶tter dig i stand til at l√∏se dine opgaver bedre og hurtigere, og som samtidig sikrer en kontinuerlig udvikling af dine kompetencer. Det er en foruds√¶tning, at du har en naturlig tilgang til samarbejde med forskellige kollegaer, og ser det som en del af dit arbejde at s√∏ge viden og sparre med andre kollegaer.

Om jobbet | Operational Analytics & Data Science

Som Data Scientist kommer du til at have mange forskellige opgaver inden for AI & Analytics og Data Science. Det betyder, at du bl.a. vil arbejde med udvikling og drift af pr√¶diktive modeller, A/B testing, webservices og cloud computing. Fokus er at skabe v√¶rdi, og derfor kan l√∏sningen i nogle tilf√¶lde v√¶re simple regler og i andre tilf√¶lde mere avancerede statistiske modeller.

Tryg har en ambiti√∏s AI og data strategi og arbejder m√•lrettet for at etablere en Cloud baseret data- og analyseplatform, s√• det bliver hurtigere og nemmere at sikre tilg√¶ngeligheden af data, forbedre processer og sikre de rigtige v√¶rkt√∏jer.

Dine arbejdsopgaver som Data Scientist vil typisk v√¶re:

  • Udvikle og tr√¶ne pr√¶diktive modeller
  • Drifte modeller og applikationer i et cloud milj√∏
  • Integrere datakilder i nye og eksisterende applikationer
  • Effektm√•ling via monitorering og A/B testing
  • Udvikle services til interaktion og overv√•gning af applikationer
  • Udvikle og arbejde med GenAI og LLM

De vigtigste v√¶rkt√∏jer, som vi benytter, er bl.a. Microsoft Azure med Python, MLflow, Kubernetes, Docker, GitLab, Kafka og SQL, men vi er meget √•bne for at tage nye teknologier i brug.

Om dig | Skarp Data Scientist med fokus p√• v√¶rdiskabende Data Science l√∏sninger

Vi forventer, at du har en relevant uddannelse inden for Computer Science, Datalogi, Statistik, Matematik eller tilsvarende. Derudover er det en fordel, hvis du har hands-on erfaring med end-to-en Machine Learning processen, der bl.a. omfatter:

  • Databehandling
  • Model udvikling
  • Implementering og monitorering af modeller i produktion

Der er en forventning om, at du har kendskab til de mest almindelige Data Science v√¶rkt√∏jer og sprog, og som et minimum er flydende i Python. Udover Python, s√• benytter vi Kubernetes, Microsoft Azure, MLflow, Docker, GitLab, Kafka, SQL mv. og et kendskab til disse vil v√¶re en fordel.

Vigtigst af alt er dog, at du br√¶nder at g√∏re en forskel gennem udvikling af pr√¶diktive modeller og eksperimentelle analyser sammen med os!

Vi ser frem til at h√∏re fra dig!

Har du sp√∏rgsm√•l eller √∏nsker at vide mere, er du velkommen til at kontakte Head of Data & BI, Anette Schr√∏der Mikkelsen via mail: anette.m@tryg.dk .

Vi forpligter os til en retf√¶rdig og inkluderende rekrutteringsproces med lige muligheder for alle. I den forbindelse opfordrer vi til, at du undlader at inkludere et foto i dit CV. ‚ÄØ

Vi indkalder til samtaler fra august.

Ans√∏gningsfrist: d. 19. august 2024.

job rekvisition ID: 26291

Vi er en del af Solsikkeprogrammet og opfordrer alle uanset k√∏nsidentitet, alder, baggrund, handikap eller oprindelse til at s√∏ge stillingen. Vi er stolte af at have h√∏j medarbejdertilfredshed, st√¶rk faglighed og lige muligheder for at udvikle sin karriere i Tryg-koncernen. Tryg er Skandinaviens st√∏rste skadesforsikringsselskab med aktiviteter i Danmark, Norge og Sverige. I Danmark best√•r koncernen blandt andet af Tryg, Alka, TJM og Tryg Garanti. TryghedsGruppen er hovedejer af Tryg-koncernen og st√•r bag TrygFonden. Sammen arbejder vi hver dag, p√• hver vores m√•de, for at g√∏re danskernes hverdag mere tryg. Se mere p√• www.tryg.dk

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist
Description:
Would you like to be part of transforming a Finance organization with data and advanced analytics?‚ÄØDo you enjoy coding, designing, and implementing data science solutions for real world problems? Are you passionate about working in a multinational environment and partnering with business experts across the company globally?

If so, then we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our Advanced Analytics team in Business Finance, as a (Senior) Data Scientist. Apply today for a life-changing career!

The Position
As our (Senior) Data Scientist, you will be part of a team tasked with translating the requirements of use-cases from a business point of view, into advanced analytics solutions. This will be backed up by thorough and iterative data wrangling and model exploration.

Furthermore, you will be responsible to:



Drive the development of Machine Learning solutions, to enable sustainable data injection, data processing, Machine Learning modelling and outputs serving, aimed at providing business partners with actionable insights through Proof of Concept (PoC) and Minimum Viable Product (MVP)
Ensure analytics models and Machine Learning pipelines‚Äô interpretability and replicability
Improve our team‚Äôs efficiency by optimizing and automating current processes
Onboard stakeholders of our AI journey and together with the team, ensure derived insights are being applied to key business processes
Strengthen our in-house capabilities in the space of data science and the use of best technology practices through knowledge sharing with colleagues




The position is located in our HQ in Bagsv√¶rd (Greater Copenhagen area), with flexible working possibilities.

Qualifications

We are looking for a candidate who has:



+3 years of experience (5+ years for the Senior Data Scientist position) of hands-on experience within implementing data science solutions, Machine Learning & other Advanced Analytics projects, preferably in a corporate finance setting
Master of Science in Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics, Economics or similar.
Proficient knowledge and strong hands-on experience in developing and applying predictive and prescriptive modelling in Python is a must and familiarity with other programming languages is a plus
Data management knowledge (e.g. SQL) and SAP experience as a plus
Preferably, experience in cloud computing, e.g. Azure and data bricks and Azure Machine Learning
Ideally, fundamental knowledge of corporate finance




On a personal level, you have strong self-learning and communication skills, with ability to collaborate across business and technology functions. Furthermore, you are a team player and enjoy sparring with peers and co-workers to drive insights and provide recommendations on existing business process optimization.

About The Team / Department

The Advanced Analytics team is part of the BI & Advanced Analytics department in the global finance organization. We are a highly diverse team consisting of data scientists, BI developers, project managers, and partners from different countries. Our team is united by a shared drive to develop and deliver data-driven solutions to our stakeholders. With the growing demand for advanced analytics solutions, we are expanding our team to drive even more use-cases and accelerate the digitalization and AI ambition of the global finance organization.

Working at Novo Nordisk
We are a proud life-science company, and life is our reason to exist. We‚Äôre inspired by life in all its forms and shapes, ups and downs, opportunities and challenges. For employees at Novo Nordisk, life means many things ‚Äì from the building blocks of life that form the basis of ground-breaking scientific research, to our rich personal lives that motivate and energise us to perform our best at work. Ultimately, life is why we‚Äôre all here - to ensure that people can lead a life independent of chronic disease.

Contact
For further information, please contact Ling Feng Head of Advanced Analytics at LGFN@novonordisk.com.

Deadline
18 August 2024.

To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we‚Äôre life changing.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Dreamdata is the industry leader in B2B marketing attribution, optimization and automation. Founded by ex-Trustpilot product and engineering leaders starting in 2019 after building the platform internally, Dreamdata is on a mission to empower marketing professionals by democratizing access and usability of data.

Taking on the complex world of B2B marketing data Dreamdata helps marketing leaders to connect their efforts across all marketing channels to real revenue - something that wasn‚Äôt fully possible until now.

We are expanding our team to further empower our customers and ensure their success. This is where you come in. We are scaling our product team in our Copenhagen office.

As a Data Scientist at Dreamdata you will be part of a cross-functional product team consisting of Software Engineering, Design and Product Manager.

At Dreamdata data is not just a support function - it is our product and what we do !

You will be responsible for the data function part of the team to build and iterate on our main product, ensuring that data pipelines and transformations are built using best practices and are transparent and easy-to-use for our customers.

You will also be part of the broader data group consisting of the analytics engineers and data scientists from other teams. Together we maintain the fundamental data models that power the entire Dreamdata product.

Requirements


You have 2-4 years of experience in a data related role such as analytics engineer, data engineer, data analyst, data scientist or a similar role.
You most likely have real-world experience in working with data from multiple sources, extracting, visualizing, and explaining insights to stakeholders. Previous experience working with marketing and sales data is considered a plus.
You are fluent in SQL. We use Google BigQuery, but experience with other cloud data warehouses like Snowflake, AWS Redshift, Azure SQL etc. is equally relevant.
We use GCP Dataform for the majority of data transformations but experience with dbt or transformation libraries like Pandas, Polar, tidyr, dplyr etc. is also relevant.
You have some exposure to other coding languages like Python, golang, Typescript etc
We use Github, but other version control systems are equally relevant.
You have played with visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, Power BI, Alteryx etc. Experience using open source Python/R-based visualization libraries is equally relevant.
We are heavy users of Google Cloud Platform, but exposure to the other public clouds are also considered a plus.


If you think the role sounds exciting, but you don‚Äôt match all points, don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out as we are continuously hiring also with opportunities for less senior profiles.

Benefits


Flexibility - we are sharing our time between the office and remote work.
Equity - be part of the growth journey ahead.
Lunch at the office.
Office next to the waterfront, in the heart of Copenhagen.
A company where you will get the chance to grow with the company.


Who is Dreamdata?

We are a young company with big ambitions, but also a company that emphasizes that it should be fun going to work. We are currently 18 nationalities from all over the world. You will also have opportunities to participate in activities outside of work.

We get together for various non-workrelated events to get to know our colleagues across the company and simply to have a good time together.

https://dreamdata.io/blog/summer-fun-at-dreamdata

https://dreamdata.io/blog/building-the-dream-team-at-dreamdata
Show more

Title: Frontend Developer Intern
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Frontend Developer Intern at Codezo

About Us

Codezo is a fast-growing tech company that provides top-notch solutions for our diverse range of clients. We value innovation, creativity, and adaptability in our team members. As a young and vibrant company, we're dedicated to fostering an environment of growth and learning.

Job Description

We are looking for a talented Frontend Developer Intern with a solid understanding of JavaScript/TypeScript, React, and React Native. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the design and implementation of user interfaces and ui components.

Responsibilities


Develop and maintain web and mobile applications using React and React Native.
Collaborate with backend developers and web designers to improve usability.
Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs.
Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.
Build reusable code and libraries for future use.


Requirements


Proven work experience as a Frontend developer.
Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript and React, React Native.
Knowledge of Kotlin, Swift, and Flutter will be considered a plus.
Excellent problem-solving skills.
Team player with strong communication skills.


Benefits


Opportunities for career advancement.
Exciting and challenging work environment.
Work with a dynamic and innovative team.


Apply now and be part of our exciting journey!

For more information or questions please contact us at jacob@codezo.dk or phone number +45 21461869

Title: Applications Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Moment s√∏ger p√• vegne af JAI..




Kunne du t√¶nke dig at arbejde i et internationalt, fagligt st√¶rkt og nyskabende arbejdsmilj√∏ inden for Vision-industrien? S√• er det m√•ske dig, vi s√∏ger!




JAI er f√∏rende global producent af h√∏jkvalitets, industrielle kameraer til forskellige markeder, herunder maskinsyn, transport, f√∏devare- og drikkevareindustrien, luftfart, medicinsk og den videnskabelige sektor.




Som Applications Engineer bliver du bindeleddet mellem udviklingen (back-end) og kunderne, og du f√•r en altafg√∏rende rolle i, at skabe tillidsfulde og trov√¶rdige relationer til kunderne gennem dialog, r√•dgivning og sparring. Du kommer til at arbejde med integration og fejlfinding via JAI‚Äôs software development kit samt kundernes applikationer, for at tilpasse de enkelte produkter.




Global virksomhed med samarbejde p√• tv√¶rs af landegr√¶nser

I stillingen som Applications Engineer bliver du en del af afdelingen, Global Application Support, der best√•r af 8 dygtige kolleger fordelt p√• 6 lande, hvoraf 3 sidder i Danmark. Teamet er kendetegnet ved en udpr√¶get hold√•nd, h√∏j faglighed og en god portion humor. Du vil referere til VP for Strategy & Digital Innovation, og du bliver en del af en organisation med flad ledelsesstruktur i et positivt og professionelt samarbejdsklima, hvor der i h√∏j grad lyttes til initiativer og gode id√©er.




Du f√•r en central rolle i organisationen i forhold til at udvikle samt drive afg√∏rende projekter, og du vil f√• et stort personligt ansvar for forretningskritiske opgaver. Har du kompetencerne og √∏nsket, er der i stillingen ogs√• mulighed for at avancere til Manager.




Du vil f√• f√∏lgende arbejdsopgaver:

At h√•ndtere teknisk kr√¶vende henvendelser fra kunder via Zendesk og pr. E-mail.
At opbygge og facilitere forbindelse mellem kamerahardware og eksisterende billedbehandlingsbiblioteker, til at skrive/teste scripts og v√¶re involveret i applikationsrelateret softwareudvikling.
At opbygge test, der replicerer kundernes udfordringer, unders√∏ge sammenh√¶nge og √•rsager, og p√• baggrund af unders√∏gelserne komme med anbefalinger og l√∏sninger.
At yde sparring omkring hardware ud fra din dybdeg√•ende viden om sensorer, kameraer, optik mv.
At give feedback og komme med anbefalinger til R&D-ingeni√∏rerne baseret p√• kundernes feedback og krav.
At assistere salg med at afslutte ordrer p√• baggrund af software relaterede problemer.




Din profil og faglighed

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
There is no quality healthcare without a quality dialogue. Today, that dialogue is broken; we need you to help us fix it.

Doctors and nurses across the world are facing unprecedented challenges. When we meet them, they're dealing with heavy workloads, extensive paperwork, and the pressure of performing well, which in healthcare, can have dire consequences. This system is gradually undermining the passion and autonomy of our dedicated healthcare professionals, who entered this field to provide care, not to clerk.

Corti has built the world's premier AI assistant for healthcare providers. It listens in during patient dialogue, takes notes, writes summaries, journals and does quality assurance. When information is missed, or risk is high, it offers nudges and prompts to help steer the dialogue back on the right path. Entire countries trust Corti to deliver better healthcare, and our AI has already helped millions of patients, but we are just getting started.

At Corti, we are growing fast and always looking for skillful people to ensure we go in the right direction. If you enjoy working in an autonomous and collaborative team, guided by shared values and a willingness to act, iterate, and learn, then join us at Corti as a Senior Machine Learning Engineer

üìå As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be part of our machine learning R&D team and work closely with our product teams. The machine learning R&D team consists of seasoned engineers as well as several Ph.D. students and postdocs collaborating with Danish and international universities. Our product teams are cross-functional and own product discovery and delivery end-to-end.

You can read more about our research and publications here: https://corti.ai/company/research

Our vision, products, and solutions to enrich patient consultations are described here: https://corti.ai/

In this role, you will work alongside our other machine learning engineers and researchers, developing new models, implementing state-of-the-art research outputs, and translating those outputs into tangible product outcomes. For example, you might be involved in the prototyping a new machine learning-based product feature in collaboration with other teams. Or you might work independently on taking state-of-the-art research and assessing how well it works in Corti‚Äôs domain. There are many possibilities and plenty of room for creativity and bringing in your own ideas.

The impact you'll have


Develop prototypes based on cutting-edge applied machine learning working on audio, text, and structured data sources.
Own the technical translation of state-of-the-art machine learning innovations to inform the development of new product features.
Design and implement well-defined APIs for new machine learning tools to make them available for customers and across the organization.
Participate in research ventures and drive publication at top machine learning venues or impactful digital medicine journals.
Improve healthcare globally as part of your daily work.


You'll thrive in this role if you have the following


A higher university degree or Ph.D. in computer science, computer engineering, mathematics, statistics, physics, or a related interdisciplinary field.
In-depth experience with Python and strong command of data structures and algorithms in order to contribute to production-grade code.
In-depth knowledge of one or more of the major machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch or TensorFlow).
Ability to manage machine learning research projects and clearly communicate outcomes to technical and non-technical audiences.


Nice to have


Publication history at top machine learning venues (e.g., NeurIPS, ACL, or digital medicine journals) that shows that you can drive research projects.
Hands-on experience with automatic speech recognition or natural language processing.


Practicalities


The work location for this position is preferred in Copenhagen, but we can be flexible with the right candidate.
This is a full-time position, starting as soon as possible.


Ready to dive into the world of Corti? Hit that 'Apply' button, and let's start working together on reshaping the dialogue in healthcare, making a real difference for millions of patient outcomes around the world.

ü§ù Bringing in top talent from all backgrounds is crucial in our pursuit to improve the world of healthcare. We encourage applications from all people and do not discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, and/or disability status.Ôªø

At Corti, experience comes in many forms, and we‚Äôre passionate about creating teams with a multitude of perspectives! If you believe your experience is close to what we‚Äôre looking for but not an exact match, we still hope you‚Äôll consider applying!

At Corti, experience comes in many forms, and we‚Äôre passionate about creating teams with a multitude of perspectives! If you believe your experience is close to what we‚Äôre looking for but not an exact match, we still hope you‚Äôll consider applying!

Title: Senior Machine Learning Solutions Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
There is no quality healthcare without a quality dialogue. Today, that dialogue is broken; we need you to help us fix it.

Doctors and nurses across the world are facing unprecedented challenges. When we meet them, they're dealing with heavy workloads, extensive paperwork, and the pressure of performing well, which in healthcare, can have dire consequences. This system is gradually undermining the passion and autonomy of our dedicated healthcare professionals, who entered this field to provide care, not to clerk.

Corti has built the world's premier AI assistant for healthcare providers. It listens in during patient dialogue, takes notes, writes summaries, journals and does quality assurance. When information is missed, or risk is high, it offers nudges and prompts to help steer the dialogue back on the right path. Entire countries trust Corti to deliver better healthcare, and our AI has already helped millions of patients, but we are just getting started.

About the roleIn this role, you will act as a trusted advisor to prospective and existing customers. You will also work directly with our sales team, product team and ML Engineering team to provide value-based evaluation scenarios including demonstrations, labs, and POVs, to aid in closing business. You will sit at the intersection of product, sales and engineering and will work with the broader team to continue building the world's premier AI assistant for healthcare providers.

In This Role, You‚Äôll


Own the technical aspects of the sales cycle, designing and leading a tailored and business value-aligned technology evaluation process
Act as a customer-facing technical resource during customer / partner meetings and technology evaluations, working with Data Scientists, AI/ML practitioners, Architects, Technologists and Product owners.
Serve as an advisor on AI to help customers with their end-to-end vision; AI strategy, operating model & architectural best practices, problem framing, data preparation, scripting, model building, model deployment, model management, and output consumption.
Interpret complex problems, create simple solutions and collaborate closely with prospects, channel partners and our sales team to deliver winning solutions that help customers to accelerate critical business outcomes with AI.
Collaborate and maintain a close working relationship with product, engineering, sales, and marketing


You‚Äôll Thrive In This Role If You Have


Experience in customer facing technical roles (can include sales at a B2B software company or DS/ML consulting)
Expertise in modern machine learning frameworks and technologies (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, transformers)
Knowledge of industry standard technologies in the Data Science and Machine Learning space
Fluency with scripting in Python
Hands-on experience building and implementing machine learning or AI models
Experience collaborating with business stakeholders to ensure that machine learning solutions deliver successfully on business outcomes
Ability to connect a customer's specific business problems to Snorkel‚Äôs differentiated platform and unique approach to ML development.University degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or related fields, or equivalent experience preferred


What We Measure Success On


Customer Impact and Satisfaction: Measure success based on the positive impact Corti's AI has on healthcare providers and their patients. This is quantified through customer satisfaction surveys, Net Promoter Scores (NPS), and the number of patient outcomes positively influenced by Corti's technology.
Technical Solution Efficacy: Success is measured by the reduction in workload for healthcare professionals, the accuracy and relevancy of the AI's notes and summaries, and the efficiency of risk identification and management.
Sales and Business Growth: Contribution to business growth through new customer acquisition, retention rates, and the expansion of Corti's services within existing accounts. Measure the role's impact on closing deals and generating revenue.
Innovation and Continuous Improvement: Measured by the ability to contribute to the ongoing enhancement of Corti's AI technology. This includes introducing new features, improving model accuracy, and adopting best practices in AI development and deployment.


Practicalities


You will work from our office in Copenhagen (hybrid).
You will be part of several yearly trips including our annual Corticon event.
You will join a multinational team passionate about revolutionizing healthcare.
You will never have had more driven or passionate colleagues before.
You will never ever be bored.


Who Are You As a Person


You are energized by purpose.
You prefer truths over comfortable illusions.
You don‚Äôt want a job where you watch the clock, but one where you make it count.
You are looking for a community of people equally as dedicated.
You embrace the pace of startup life.


Ready to dive into the world of Corti? Hit that 'Apply' button, and let's start working together on reshaping the dialogue in healthcare, making a real difference for millions of patient outcomes around the world.

ü§ù Bringing in top talent from all backgrounds is crucial in our pursuit to improve the world of healthcare. We encourage applications from all people and do not discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, and/or disability status.Ôªø

At Corti, experience comes in many forms, and we‚Äôre passionate about creating teams with a multitude of perspectives! If you believe your experience is close to what we‚Äôre looking for but not an exact match, we still hope you‚Äôll consider applying!

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Bredebro, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you interested in playing a key part in shaping the future of automation solutions at one of Denmark‚Äôs largest brands? Are you seeking a role that enables you to collaborate with a team driven by substantial technical aspirations, working on the development of cutting-edge production technology in the market?




At ECCO's HQ facilities in Bredebro, you will join the Factory 2025 department, where you will be an integral part of a dynamic software team, working collaboratively to devise and establish ECCO‚Äôs factories of tomorrow.




Engineering for the future

Stepping into this role, you will take part in developing and standardizing future production technologies and equipment, so it can be rolled out globally. This involves designing, specifying, testing, and validating the production equipment and control concepts, as well as standardising the software architecture and programming of equipment to ensure operational stability.

The type of production technology you will work with spans from process automation, involving programming of robots and sensorics, to intralogistics, involving programming of PLCs, AGVs and product transportation technologies.

You will also have the chance to explore uncharted domains, where definitive answers regarding efficacy or accuracy may not always be readily accessible. Therefore, being passionate about crafting ideal solutions and continually expanding your knowledge and skill set, are something we are looking for in our next colleague.




Your tasks include:

PLC programming (structured text) / robot programming
Implementation of sensors for production processes (vision, 2D/3D scanning, etc.)
Recipe development (process implementation)
Development, installation, commissioning, and maintenance of equipment
Documentation of technical solutions and procedures




Solid experience with automation solutions

You like to take responsibility and do not shy away from a challenge. You demonstrate a swift comprehension of advanced programming, and you are known for being out-going, proactive and having a self-motivated approach to tasks. It is also vital that you bring a thorough understand of project management, whether they are straightforward or complex. Moreover, we imagine that you:




Bring a technical education in a relevant field (e.g. Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, Engineering, etc.)
Have knowledge of industrial automation equipment, such as PLC (Beckhoff and Siemens) , loT, gateway etc.
Are experienced in controlling actual hardware (robot, actuator, etc.) based on sensed information
Are familiar with online and offline robot programming in ABB
Have experience with electrical troubleshooting
Can develop algorithms or control software in Python, Java or C++
Have knowledge in fieldbus network, Machine-to-Machine (M2M protocols )
Are proficient in version control (GIT) (it is advantageous)




Are you ready for your next challenge?

PULS Human Relations is the recruitment partner for this position. If you would like to know more about the position you are welcome to contact:




Michael Natapon Hansson, Senior Architect - Robotics & Control, ECCO: +45 2128 1986

Or

Henrik Selmer Steffensen, Recruitment Partner, PULS Human Relations: +45 43144212




After receiving and reviewing your application, we will contact you regarding the next steps in the process. We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so please send your application as soon as possible.

Apply via the link below.

We look forward to hearing from you!

CREATE THE FOOTPRINTS OF TOMORROW

At ECCO, you become part of a meaningful, developing, and multicultural workplace. You join a global family of more than 25,000 people who are proud to create the footprints of tomorrow.

Headquartered in Denmark, we are a family-owned company that offers international opportunities. Our offices and facilities have an informal culture and relaxed dress code ‚Äì our shoe code is slightly stricter.

Join us and we guarantee lifelong learning ‚Äì the speed of progress is up to you. So, if you‚Äôre curious, passionate, and ready to make an impact, you‚Äôll fit right in.

Stepping into this role, you will take part in developing and standardizing future production technologies and equipment, so it can be rolled out globally. This involves designing, specifying, testing, and validating the production equipment and control concepts, as well as standardising the software architecture and programming of equipment to ensure operational stability.

The type of production technology you will work with spans from process automation, involving programming of robots and sensorics, to intralogistics, involving programming of PLCs, AGVs and product transportation technologies.

You will also have the chance to explore uncharted domains, where definitive answers regarding efficacy or accuracy may not always be readily accessible. Therefore, being passionate about crafting ideal solutions and continually expanding your knowledge and skill set, are something we are looking for in our next colleague.


Your tasks include:

  • PLC programming (structured text) / robot programming
  • Implementation of sensors for production processes (vision, 2D/3D scanning, etc.)
  • Recipe development (process implementation)
  • Development, installation, commissioning, and maintenance of equipment
  • Documentation of technical solutions and procedures


Solid experience with automation solutions

You like to take responsibility and do not shy away from a challenge. You demonstrate a swift comprehension of advanced programming, and you are known for being out-going, proactive and having a self-motivated approach to tasks. It is also vital that you bring a thorough understand of project management, whether they are straightforward or complex. Moreover, we imagine that you:


  • Bring a technical education in a relevant field (e.g. Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, Engineering, etc.)
  • Have knowledge of industrial automation equipment, such as PLC (Beckhoff and Siemens) , loT, gateway etc.
  • Are experienced in controlling actual hardware (robot, actuator, etc.) based on sensed information
  • Are familiar with online and offline robot programming in ABB
  • Have experience with electrical troubleshooting
  • Can develop algorithms or control software in Python, Java or C++
  • Have knowledge in fieldbus network, Machine-to-Machine (M2M protocols )
  • Are proficient in version control (GIT) (it is advantageous)


Are you ready for your next challenge?

PULS Human Relations is the recruitment partner for this position. If you would like to know more about the position you are welcome to contact:


Michael Natapon Hansson, Senior Architect - Robotics & Control, ECCO: +45 2128 1986

Or

Henrik Selmer Steffensen, Recruitment Partner, PULS Human Relations: +45 43144212


After receiving and reviewing your application, we will contact you regarding the next steps in the process. We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so please send your application as soon as possible.

Apply via the link below.

We look forward to hearing from you!

CREATE THE FOOTPRINTS OF TOMORROW

At ECCO, you become part of a meaningful, developing, and multicultural workplace. You join a global family of more than 25,000 people who are proud to create the footprints of tomorrow.

Headquartered in Denmark, we are a family-owned company that offers international opportunities. Our offices and facilities have an informal culture and relaxed dress code ‚Äì our shoe code is slightly stricter.

Join us and we guarantee lifelong learning ‚Äì the speed of progress is up to you. So, if you‚Äôre curious, passionate, and ready to make an impact, you‚Äôll fit right in.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copyright Agent emerged from a deep-rooted respect for people - writers, photographers, and creators of all kinds - who have the talent and courage to be original. We work with content creators across Europe, North and South America, New Zealand, and Australia to manage and protect their intellectual property - mostly images and videos - from unlicensed use.

Why join Copyright Agent you might ask?

We are 20 people, with roots from all over the world, genuinely passionate about safeguarding the ecosystem of originality. We are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Data Scientist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of data science techniques, strong analytical skills, and the ability to lead complex projects from conception to completion. This role requires both technical expertise and the ability to communicate insights effectively to drive business outcomes.

Key Responsibilities


Advanced Data Analysis:
Utilize advanced statistical methods, machine learning, and artificial intelligence techniques to analyze complex datasets.
Develop and implement predictive models and algorithms to solve business problems and drive decision-making.
Project Leadership:
Lead data science projects, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and meet business objectives.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, finance, and sales, to integrate data science solutions seamlessly into business processes.
Technical Development:
Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and models.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in data science and AI, integrating new methodologies as appropriate.
Optimize and refine models to improve their performance and accuracy.
Communication & Collaboration:
Communicate complex data science concepts and results to non-technical stakeholders clearly and concisely.
Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand their needs and how data science can provide value.
Advocate for a data-driven culture within the organization.

Required Qualifications


A bachelor's or master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in data science or a related field.
Proven track record of delivering successful data science projects.
Strong expertise in machine learning, statistical analysis, and predictive modeling.
Proficiency in programming and query languages such as Python and SQL.
Experience with big data technologies and cloud platforms (preferably GCP, others applicable).
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas to various audiences.


Preferred Qualifications


Familiarity with data visualization tools (Looker Studio and BigQuery preferred, Power BI, Tableau etc. applicable).
Strong understanding of data governance and best practices in data management.


Expectations


Innovation & Continuous Improvement: Continuously explore new techniques and tools to enhance the data science function.
Project Execution: Deliver high-quality data science projects that provide actionable insights and drive business outcomes.
Business Impact: Demonstrate the tangible impact of data science initiatives on business performance and strategy.
Ethical Considerations: Ensure that all data science practices adhere to ethical standards and comply with relevant regulations.


Ready to join our team here at Copyright Agent?

At Copyright Agent, we believe in fostering innovation and driving excellence. We are dedicated to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive and contribute to our shared success. By joining us, you will have access to continuous learning opportunities and a vibrant work culture that values creativity and collaboration.

If this sounds interesting - then we would love to hear from you!

For more information or questions please contact us at emma@copyrightagent.com
